meanings.definition: To engage in playful or teasing behavior.
meanings.sent1: The children were jollying around in the playground.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys jollying with her friends during recess.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were jollying each other by telling funny jokes.
meanings.sent4: The puppy was jollying with its tail, wagging happily.
meanings.sent5: The clown was jollying with the audience, making everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: To encourage or cheer someone up.
meanings.sent1: He was jollying his friend who was feeling down.
meanings.sent2: The coach was jollying the team before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was jollying the students with a surprise quiz.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words were jollying up her sister after a bad day.
meanings.sent5: The music jollied up the atmosphere at the party.

meanings.definition: To amuse oneself or others in a lively and cheerful way.
meanings.sent1: She was jollying herself by watching a funny movie.
meanings.sent2: The comedian was jollying the audience with his jokes.
meanings.sent3: The cat was jollying around with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: The magician jollied up the crowd with his tricks.
meanings.sent5: The children were jollying their grandparents with a puppet show.
